TF024253-CO-FINANCING GRANT FOR THE

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings convey a satisfactory
            outcome, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts, yet, while the Bank
            performance is rated satisfactory, the Borrower's was
            highly satisfactory. The experience of the project confirmed
            the efficiency of social funds mechanisms, in improving
            living conditions of the poor through the construction of
            small-scale infrastructure, and in building social capital.
            It also confirmed that trust fund grants can serve as entry
            points in jurisdictions which are not Bank members, and its
            standard resources cannot be deployed. They can set the
            stage for follow-up operations, by setting institutional
            capabilities, and rules on activities requiring greater
            funding. In this fashion, relatively small grants can assume
            the front-end risk in uncertain circumstances, as well as
            provide bridge funds until larger support can be obtained.
            In addition it demonstrated the benefits of a
            community-based project, serving as a catalyst for a process
            participation. Nonetheless, the Community Development Fund
            (CDF) problems in the water supply and sewerage sector,
            suggest a need for particular provisions for social fund
            activity, in areas where special expertise is required to
            achieve success. Another point for Bank project design,
            concerns CDF's belief that its operating manual was
            seemingly ineffective, and therefore had to be revised.
            Concerns further include the uncertainty, and limited
            existence of these funds, the longer term establishment of
            CDF under the exigencies of post-conflict
            "emergency" conditions, and, considerations on the
            uncertainty of the roles of different government
            institutions in Kosovo.
